intro: Centaurea rhizocephala, commonly known as the root-headed centaurea, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, typically growing in dry, rocky, or sandy soils. The plant features upright, branched stems with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its bright yellow flowers are arranged in dense, spherical heads, which are characteristic of the genus Centaurea. The species is known for its adaptability to arid environments and is often found in Mediterranean-type climates.
